checkpoint.name: Blood transfusion note is written in patient recorded
Consent is taken before transfusion
Consent is taken before transfusion
Blood bank has defined criteria for donor selection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Based on Physical examination, Medical history, condition that affects safety of recipients, donation intervals,

checkpoint.name: Pre donation counselling is done before donation
Blood bank ensures that blood is taken from voluntary donors only
Check for questionnaire is available in local language for taking pre donation information
Sterility of Blood component is insured during processing
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for use of aseptic method and availability of Sterile pyrogen free disposable bags and solutions

checkpoint.name: Approximate volume of the component is indicated on bag
Blood components are prepared as per technical standards
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check availability and adherence to NACO standards

checkpoint.name: Transfusion time limits are adhered one frozen component have been thawed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Within 6 hours

checkpoint.name: Alarm system has been provided with refrigerator
Shelf life of blood and components is adhered as per NACO protocols
Check for refrigerators used for blood storage are kept at recommended temperature
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check records that temperature is maintained at 4c + 2 C

checkpoint.name: Adequate alternate storage facility available
Storage temperature is monitored at every 4 hours
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records

checkpoint.name: Check for refrigerators or freezers for blood storage are not used for storing other items
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Lab reagents etc.

checkpoint.name: There is established procedure for selection of blood and components for transfusion
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for practice in case of ABO type specific groups are not available. Issue of blood to RH+ and Negative recipient

checkpoint.name: Paediatric blood collection bags are available
Blood bank has system to testing and cross matching the recipient blood
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Testing of recipient blood includes Determination ABO type, Rh (D) type, detection of unexpected antibodies etc.

checkpoint.name: There is established procedure for re cross matching in case of massive transfusion
Determination of Rh (D) Type done as per recommended method
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the protocol/ Algorithm followed for determining RH + or RH- Blood type

checkpoint.name: Sterility of Blood units checked with adequate sample size
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check Sterility is checked at least for 1% of blood unit collected or 4 per month which ever higher by appropriate culture method

checkpoint.name: There is provision of Quarantine Storage untested blood
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for untested blood is stored in different refrigerator

checkpoint.name: Determination of ABO group is done by recommended methods
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Tube or Microplate or gel technology

checkpoint.name: Laboratory tests for Infectious diseases done as per recommended method
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: or infectious diseases (VDRL/RPR/TPHAfor syphilis, ELISA/Rapid test for Hep A, Hep B, HIV and Malaria for malarial parasite

checkpoint.name: Blood units with reactive test result area kept separately
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: In dedicate secure area with biohazard sign until disposal

checkpoint.name: Blood bank has system to ensure that final blood bags are labelled only after all mandatory testing is completed.
Blood bank has system of identification traceability of its products
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Blood bags are Identified with a numeric or alpha numeric system / Barcode

checkpoint.name: Blood bank has system to the affix the product information on bag, after processing
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Name of product, numeric information, date of collection and expiry, amount of anticoagulant and approximate blood collected, Name, address and manufacturing license number of collecting facility, storage temperature and expiry date

checkpoint.name: Instruction for transfusion are printed on label
Blood bank has colour coded scheme for differentiate ABO groups
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Blood group O -blue, Blood group A- yellow, Blood group B- Pink, Blood group AB- White

checkpoint.name: Blood bank has system to maintain temperature of collected blood immediately after donation
Blood bank has standardized procedure for collection of blood from donor
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Procedure include preparation of venepuncture site, use of blood bags and anticoagulant solution, collecting sample for laboratory test

checkpoint.name: Blood bank has identified procedure for labelling of blood bag/blood component /pilot tubes
Blood bank has system in place to monitor the transportation of the blood from camp site
Instructions for collection and handling the collected blood are communicated to those responsible for collection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Mostly numeric or alpha numeric label should be used for tracing

checkpoint.name: Blood bank has system to trace of unit of blood /component from source to final destination
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Blood should be kept at 4oC to 6oC except if it is used for component preparation it will be stored at 22oC until platelet are separated
